abstract: United Parcel Service is in talks to buy a Dutch rival, TNT, for 10 billion euros, or $15 billion, The Telegraph reported.
lead_paragraph: United Parcel Service is in talks to buy a Dutch rival, TNT, for 10 billion euros, or $15 billion, The Telegraph reported.

headline.main: U.P.S. in Talks to Buy TNT for $15 Billion, Report Says

abstract: Shares of TNT, Europe’s second-largest mail and logistics company, erased their gains from early in the trading session after Dan Brutto, president of UPS’ international business, seemed to dismiss reports from over the weekend that his company was in early talks to buy TNT for $15 billion.
snippet: Shares of TNT, Europe’s second-largest mail and logistics company, erased their gains from early in the trading session after Dan Brutto, president of UPS’ international business, seemed to dismiss reports from over the weekend that his company wa...
lead_paragraph: The markets were buzzing Monday over reports that UPS was considering a multibillion-dollar takeover in Europe. But a UPS executive suggested its deal hopes were focused elsewhere: China.

headline.main: UPS Sets Deal Sights on China
